title: Hey moderators, mind doing something nice?
body:
I made a thread over here: https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/gfzxAY8I-i-think-we-should-be-allowed-to-leave-games

The votes are being manipulated. Would you mind locking the voting?

replies.body: Having seen similar posts on this topic, this one doesn't seem downvote manipulated -- it just seems downvoted. While we encourage players to think about how they're using upvotes and downvotes, it's not actually mandatory to use them in the way we suggest. At this time we do not lock votes on request.

> [{quoted}](name=The Djinn,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=mZzkOAaa,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-12-20T04:08:47.937+0000)
>
> Having seen similar posts on this topic, this one doesn't seem downvote manipulated -- it just seems downvoted. While we encourage players to think about how they're using upvotes and downvotes, it's not actually mandatory to use them in the way we suggest. At this time we do not lock votes on request.

Under what circumstances would you lock the votes?

> [{quoted}](name=mlm olo mlm,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=mZzkOAaa,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2018-12-20T04:18:07.654+0000)Under what circumstances would you lock the votes?

Personally, I don't like to lock votes unless I'm locking a thread. We don't have an official policy for when we *do* lock votes, which is one of the reasons I discourage the practice.

> [{quoted}](name=The Djinn,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=mZzkOAaa,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2018-12-20T04:40:49.714+0000)
>
> Personally, I don't like to lock votes unless I'm locking a thread. We don't have an official policy for when we *do* lock votes, which is one of the reasons I discourage the practice.

I've seen it done before. (Have I? Am I imagining things?)

Well since you don't have an official policy, would you mind doing it as a favor to me? 

In my defense, the thread is thoughtful. The thread has encouraged discussion. The thread does not break any universal boards rules. The thread has a poll that people can use to express their disagreement without debilitating the thread.

> [{quoted}](name=mlm olo mlm,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=mZzkOAaa,comment-id=0003000000000000,timestamp=2018-12-20T04:55:53.092+0000)I've seen it done before. [Have I? Am I imagining things?]

It happens rarely, when we're pretty damn sure manipulation is occurring. I still don't like it.

> Well since you don't have an official policy, would you mind doing it as a favor to me?

As I said, at this time we do not lock votes on request.

> [{quoted}](name=The Djinn,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=mZzkOAaa,comment-id=00030000000000000000,timestamp=2018-12-20T05:19:05.423+0000)
>
> It happens rarely, when we're pretty damn sure manipulation is occurring. I still don't like it.
> 
> As I said, at this time we do not lock votes on request.

You also said that you don't have an official policy. It sounds like the official policy is to not lock votes on request. To lock votes on vote manipulation only.

Would you mind telling me what is "vote manipulation"?

> [{quoted}](name=mlm olo mlm,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=mZzkOAaa,comment-id=000300000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-12-20T05:30:33.255+0000)You also said that you don't have an official policy.

We do have a policy of not locking thread voting on request save in *extremely* extenuating circumstances.

> Would you mind telling me what is "vote manipulation"?

There is not an official definition which is, again, why I dislike the practice. It's really mainly a discretionary thing based on our knowledge of general board reactions vs. how much a thread varies from an expected reaction within a short time frame. If we see something like a -17 spike within 30 minutes on a normally popular topic, for example, something is likely up. Same with a +20 spike on a normally unpopular topic.

> [{quoted}](name=The Djinn,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=mZzkOAaa,comment-id=0003000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-12-20T05:44:18.055+0000)
>
> We do have a policy of not locking thread voting on request save in *extremely* extenuating circumstances.
>

It's really mainly a discretionary thing based on our knowledge of general board reactions vs. how much a thread varies from an expected reaction within a short time frame. If we see something like a -17 spike within 30 minutes on a normally popular topic, for example, something is likely up. Same with a +20 spike on a normally unpopular topic.

My topic is unique. I am unable to find another thread where people are discussing the system as a whole like I am. There is no expected reaction. 

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/TcXaA9Fn-players-should-allow-to-leave-without-penalty-when-another-person-quits

Partially related. Has majority upvotes.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/cdngJJAB-being-held-hostage-in-a-game-is-the-worst-feeling

Similar topic. Has majority upvotes.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/vGssEo9E-how-much-less-toxic-this-game-would-be-if-we-could-leave-4v5s-early-like-ever-other-decent-game

Similar topic. Has majority upvotes.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/6HQPrTEV-normal-matchmaking-is-a-massive-joke-id-rather-just-leave-than-play-these-games

I address this issue. Has majority upvotes.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/JjjgxPcv-mid-game-afk

Similar topic. Majority downvotes. Small quantity of votes.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/oiXqVgff-leaving-a-bot-game-punishment-yes-or-no

Most similar yet. Even votes. Small quantity of votes.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/FAX5BuvM-why-isnt-leaving-punished-the-same-as-flaming

Suggests harsher punishments. -1 net votes. Small quantity of votes.

Going by similar topics and their popularity, my thread should not be expected downvoted. Definitely not  as much as it has been.

Food for thought.

All of those are different to yours.

Asking for the ability to freely leave after it's already 4v5 is different than asking for the ability to freely leave whenever.

Complaining about often being stuck in a 4v5 situation is the opposite of what your suggesting, as your suggestion would make a 4v5 more common.

Complaining about a specific stomp is different than suggesting something that would just make things worse.

Inquiring why leaving isn't as punished as verbal abuse is again, the opposite direction that your thread is going as you're making a suggestion for even fewer punishments for leaving.

None of those posts are similar enough to yours, you even shot down one of the common requests of wanting the ability to leave once someone else has left in your own thread.

> [{quoted}](name=AeroWaffle,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=mZzkOAaa,comment-id=000300000000000000000000000000000001,timestamp=2018-12-20T06:25:29.947+0000)

I didn't. I misunderstood them. After clarification, I assured them that they would be able to leave the game.
And you got a unique amount of votes, I'm not seeing the problem.

> [{quoted}](name=AeroWaffle,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=mZzkOAaa,comment-id=00030000000000000000000000000000000100000000,timestamp=2018-12-20T06:37:30.521+0000)
>

The problem is people spamming downvotes and calling the idea "insanely shitty" without providing evidence or reasoning. 

> This board is all about fostering a healthy community

Tell me which part of that is fostering a healthy community?

> [{quoted}](name=mlm olo mlm,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=mZzkOAaa,comment-id=000300000000000000000000000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2018-12-20T07:05:41.196+0000)The problem is people spamming downvotes and calling the idea "insanely shitty" without providing evidence or reasoning.

It's frustrating, definitely. It is not, however, something that is actually against the rules. I know that's annoying to hear, but we don't have the moderators necessary to lock voting on request (and I don't like locking voting period), so I don't like setting a precedent.

> [{quoted}](name=mlm olo mlm,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=mZzkOAaa,comment-id=00030000000000000000000000000000000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-12-20T19:10:00.145+0000)You make the rules. You are a moderator. You have sole discretion over punishments.

So when I say that this I do not believe this thread was manipulated so much as simply disliked, and that down-voting is not against the rules and I will not be locking the thread, that is indeed my call as a moderator who gets the discretion to make that choice. I am sorry if you do not agree with it, but it is my call in this situation.

> [{quoted}](name=mlm olo mlm,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=mZzkOAaa,comment-id=00030000000000000000000000000000000100000000000000000002,timestamp=2018-12-20T19:43:51.148+0000)How long until yall make decisions on "negativity in player behavior"? Seems like the timing of that thread might be a little rough on yall.

We're still discussing it internally. It would also not apply to people disliking an idea though -- simply to expressing that dislike in the rude manner we sometimes see on PB, such as comments like "Glad you're gone" or "don't let the door hit you on the way out" as responses to bans.

>I get the feeling moderators are split on that issue.

Not especially, no. More that changes to voting involve a wide array of consequences, so it always takes extra deliberation. We're careful, not divided.

> [{quoted}](name=mlm olo mlm,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=mZzkOAaa,comment-id=00030000000000000000000000000000000100000000000000000004,timestamp=2018-12-21T00:37:27.696+0000)I get the feeling moderators are split on that issue.

The team has a wide range of opinions on downvotes. Many of us feel there are positive *and* negative elements to them, and we definitely need to weigh both arguments pretty carefully. I wouldn't say we're "split," though, so much as considering all opinions.

> [{quoted}](name=The Djinn,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=mZzkOAaa,comment-id=00030000000000000000000000000000000100000000000000000003,timestamp=2018-12-20T21:00:22.581+0000)

Feedback appreciated, as it usually is, but, in my estimation and experience, I do not think the response is sufficiently out-of-line for me to consider this a case of vote manipulation, and will not be taking any actions as a result.
I downvoted it because it's an insanely shitty idea. Not because I'm some phantom manipulator.

You have provided no evidence, and I can find none from a cursory glance (although I will admit I did not see the first minutes to hour of the thread), that manipulation is occurring.

Also, a sarcastic passive-aggressive post is unlikely to encourage people to waste even more of their time on what they consider nonsense, especially when it comes after a conspiracy theory, which followed a terrible idea. FWIW I thought you had a decent proposal, but I honestly don't think it's vote manipulation.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/ITFIpNUE

Upvotes and downvotes are intrinsically tied to how threads and comments are perceived. It’s easy to simply downvote something you disagree with, and upvote things that support your views. We can do better. Consider upvoting thoughtful discussions and comments, even if they disagree with your perception of things. The more valuable conversation we have on the boards and the more that conversation is recognized as a good contribution to the community, the better everyone’s board experience will be.

Yes, I know. I've read the rules. I always make it a point to try and vote/comment/rate on all the posts I click on. 

 I'm just saying that it's probably not someone intentionally trying to ruin your post as the term 'vote manipulation' suggests, it's just people being ignorant as some always do when it comes to forums like the Boards or Reddit. It happens. 

 There's not much of a valid reason for the moderators to lock your post. I'd suggest giving more suggestions for alternatives and adding factual evidence (like percentages of games with AFKers/ragers/dodgers) and trying to move it up to the Gameplay+ section.
